meta.title: From SPLIT to FICTION
meta.author: Adal Rifai
meta.author_bio: Adal Rifai is an improviser, podcaster, producer and writer in Chicago. He is the creator and co-host of the podcast '[Hey Riddle Riddle](https://www.heyriddleriddle.com/)' and co-hosts the podcasts '[Hello From the Magic Tavern](https://hellofromthemagictavern.com/)' and '[Gumshoes & Dragons](https://www.gumshoesanddragons.com/)'.
meta.message: Today's Raddle is by Adal Rifai. Adal writes, "My wife and I both love video games but are typically at opposite ends of the spectrum; me hacking my way through Elden Ring and her cozied up to Yoshi's Crafted World. However [Split Fiction](https://www.ea.com/en/games/split-fiction/split-fiction) is the rare game/couch co-op that we both adored. In the same vein (and from the same studio Hazelight) as the incredible 'It Takes Two', 'Split Fiction' oscillates at a great pace between playing in sci-fi and fantasy worlds. From riding gravity-defying motorcycles and wielding a laser whip, to playing as farting pigs searching for apples, this game is an absolute delight."
